titles.ar: كتاب الْعِتْقِ وَ التَّدْبِيرِ وَ الْكِتَابَةِ
titles.en: THE BOOK OF EMANCIPATION (LIBERATION), AND THE ARRANGEMENT, AND THE CONTRACT (OF SLAVES)

titles.ar: باب عِتْقِ وَلَدِ الزِّنَا وَ الذِّمِّيِّ وَ الْمُشْرِكِ وَ الْمُسْتَضْعَفِ
titles.en: Chapter 8 – Emancipation of a son of adultery (bastard), and the Zimmy (under the responsibility), and the Polytheist, and the oppressed

titles.ar: باب عِتْقِ وَلَدِ الزِّنَا وَ الذِّمِّيِّ وَ الْمُشْرِكِ وَ الْمُسْتَضْعَفِ
titles.en: Chapter 8 – Emancipation of a son of adultery (bastard), and the Zimmy (under the responsibility), and the Polytheist, and the oppressed

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ عَلِيّاً ( عليه السلام ) أَعْتَقَ عَبْداً لَهُ نَصْرَانِيّاً فَأَسْلَمَ حِينَ أَعْتَقَهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Al Hassan Bin Salih, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said that Ali<sup>asws</sup> emancipated a Christian slave of his<sup>asws</sup>, so he became a Muslim when he<sup>asws</sup> emancipated him’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدٌ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ حَفْصٍ عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يُعْتَقَ وَلَدُ الزِّنَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad, from Ahmad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Umar Bin Hafs, from Saeed Bin Yasaar, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is no problem with emancipating a son of adultery (bastard)’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدٌ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الرَّقَبَةُ تُعْتَقُ مِنَ الْمُسْتَضْعَفِينَ قَالَ نَعَمْ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad, from Ahmad, form his father Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ibn Muskan, from Al Halby who said, 
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The (freeing of) a neck can be an emancipation from the oppressed?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes’.
